Cb:
Watermark C.b. can be distinguished by several features: there is a fleur-de-lis in the arch below the crown, the crown is double banded and the top band contains jewels, and the initials VA or AV can be found below the shield.

________________________________________________________________________

This watermark can be found on the following print:

  • The angel appearing to the shepherds, 1634, (B. 44 i/ NHD 125 i), British Museum, London (BM 1973-U.850)

(Erik Hinterding, Rembrandt as an Etcher, 2006, II, 63)
